metadata.title: CVE-2020-25632 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in grub2 in versions prior to 2.06. The rmmodimplementation allows the unloading of a module used as a dependencywithout checking if any other dependent module is still loaded leading to ause-after-free scenario. This could allow arbitrary code to be executed ora bypass of Secure Boot protections. The highest threat from thisvulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as systemavailability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25632` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

grub-efi-amd64 - 2.04-1ubuntu42
grub-efi-amd64-bin - 2.04-1ubuntu42
grub-efi-arm64 - 2.04-1ubuntu42
grub-efi-arm64-bin - 2.04-1ubuntu42
No subscription required

grub-efi-amd64-signed - 1.164
grub-efi-arm64-signed - 1.164
No subscription required

criterions.comment: grub2-unsigned package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.04-1ubuntu42').
grub2-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.164').
grub2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
